flawed_nl_solution:
There were 1150-150=<<1150-150=1000>>1000 people who didn't vote for John
That means James got 1000*0.7=<<1000*0.7=700>>700 votes
So the other candidate got 1000-700=<<1000-700=3000>>3000 votes
This means he got 3000-150=<<3000-150=2850>>2850 more votes than John.
#### 2850

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
